Reviews.Title: “Beach club is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Dray121212
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in the hotel but I never left the beach club. Awesome beds, service, and view! Paulo, Pablo and the rest of the staff were awesome! Great drinks and good food. I will be back soon to see my new friends and enjoy the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JAS20016
Reviews.Content: For almost $300 a night, It would be great if the toilet flushed properly, the water pressure was consistent, the blankets were cigarette-burn free and the beds had some foam padding. That said, the location right on the beach with above-average service and comfortable day beds was great. The men's toilet by the beach was broken - kinda gross. But the staff was friendly, the drinks were great and so was the food.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 days at this hotel and it was wonderful. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. The beach club is extremely comfortable with beds to lounge on and palm trees for shade. The staff is very attentive at the beach club and the food is delicious! The rooms and simple and clean with fantastic air conditioners. We had a deluxe room and it was the perfect size for two people. It was also very quiet at night. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Perfect couples getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Pat King”
Reviews.Author: pmtking
Reviews.Content: If you want a standard hotel with 3 restaurant's and a pool this isnt for you. This is a perfect couples get away..small (33 rooms), great beach front, nice little cafe on the beach that serves simple but good food. For us the service has always been outstanding..this is our second visit and we will be back again. The rooms are not that of a 4star..if you spend alot of time in your room this may bother you..not alot of clothes storage so pack lite. 4 stars for the staff, service, and location...a wonerful 7 days for us.

Reviews.Title: “Many other great hotels in the area!”
Reviews.Author: INdaWhite
Reviews.Content: This would be our 1st Tripadvisor review, we are not the once to complain and we make the best of it. Searched and searched on Tripadvisor to find a nice hotel and we thought we will give this hotel a try. Beach front and location looked great. This experience made us post on Tripadvisor. Dont do it, many other options @ PDC We booked the most expensive top suite they have, we arrived at 4:15pm, they said we booked a regular room and try to argue with us we made a mistake, we showed the room confirmation (we booked directly with the hotel), then they try to say, the room is under renovation and wont be ready for awhile. we waited till 7pm to get the room. Service was POOR!! looks like they hired all the underage staff at this hotel. not well spoken. not something you expect to be at a high end hotel (not sure if it is high end, just assumed by the price). Then they called us on the last day, reminding us the check out is at 12pm. You can not take the taxi to the hotel, you have to carry your own luggage down the street to get to this hotel. One of the worst experience we had with this hotel for almost $600/per night (not all inclusive), we walked the beached the same day and found some amazing options. The Royal is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place - great location and extraordinary service!”
Reviews.Author: Mikkel T
Reviews.Content: This place has a great location just next to the beach and with a fashionable interior design arrangement it meets all the requirements for a great and relaxing vacation. The staff is very kind and shows an excellent service minded attitude. Futhermore its a good point of departure for day trips. We really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the most over-priced hotel in Mexico..”
Reviews.Author: samboo73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a junior suite at $340 a night, room 101 to be exact. I had expected a junior suite to have a view. No. Chairs inside the room. No. Some kind of airflow, lighting. No. Also the fridge didn't work and wasn't replaced for 4 days. But these aren't my biggest gripes. You don't have to stay here to use the (excellent) Mosquito Beach facilities. They have deals with the other hotels in the area ($100-$150 a night hotels, presumably so their kitchen is always busy, which it seemed to be). So anyone can come and lie down in pole position wherever they want and still enjoy saving $200+ a night. (And let's face it, how long are you in the room for anyway?) The food on the beach is quite good, service only OK. And they stand over your shoulder while you write in how much tip you're leaving. It's all a bit... carnivorous. I'm pretty sure we got the dud room, 101, but either way, you'd do better staying a block back from the beach at a hotel with a facilities deal. I was really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, variable service”
Reviews.Author: 19katy80
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be ranked higher on tripadvisor. The location is great. We spent ages at the beach club. The beach staff are excellent, very friendly and efficient. The beach is beautiful, there are loads of comfy beach beds (so much better than sun loungers!) and the sea is a nice temperature for swimming. We also swam in the pool a couple of times which was always quiet and made a nice change from the beach. I thought the room decor was beautiful. It wasn't huge but plenty big enough and really comfortable. It is dark, but i liked that. It was nice to come back to a dark, cool room after the heat and light of outside. There are a couple of minor improvements they could make in the rooms. There was no full length mirror, I think this is the only hotel I have ever stayed in that didn't have one!! Also, the water pressure in the shower was a bit weak and the cosmetics they provide were a bit limited, and they didn't have slippers. All minor points...buy still things I would expect to find in hotels in this price range. The biggest problem was some of the front desk staff. While they were all friendly enough they just didn't sort stuff out and didn't seem to care too much about helping their guests. The exception to this was one guy called Luis Angel who was really, really helpful. Overall I really enjoyed staying here. If they can sort out these few problems with the staff and rooms it would be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mario C
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Mexico and the Hotel was a recommendation from a friend. Reading all the reviews before the trip, I have to say, it depends what you expect. We were looking for a week of pure beach relaxation and a nice ambience. The Hotel is directly at the Beach and has very nice beach neds .. as it is an "Adults only" facility, it is very quite. The Food is top quality and the location next to 5th Avenue is perfect. We had a Suite which was with a nice Ocean View, but the other rooms looked pretty small - but hey, what do you want in a room if you're in Mexico anyway! If you look for a vacation in Style with a great location and good food - this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything better at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: andrew h
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hostess is practically a supermodel. Secondly they have free breakfast on the ocean every morning. This isn't terrible hotel breakfast, its delicious and they'll pretty much make anything you want. Room was plenty nice, everything worked well, no complaints and all the staff was friendly. It was the best hotel we stayed at and they cheapest too. I read that things things don't go as smoothly during the busy season but we had the best experience we could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: DM0ntreal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful , very modern look. The staff is extremely friendly and always aim to please their guests and meet our needs. I've stayed in 2 different types of rooms that the hotel offers and both were beautiful. The beach beds offered by the hotel are the best offered on the beach of PDC. The best room is the Ocean view suite if your lucky enough and it's not taken then I strongly suggest you book it. The view from the balcony is spectacular !!! I would stay there again without any questions asked and I strongly recommend it to anyone going to playa that is looking for a hotel that is modern, has style, has great location and has great staff....

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach hotel, and some tips.”
Reviews.Author: mg33706
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week there, after leaving the much needing improvement Las Palapas but that is another story. This hotel is clean, and the people friendly. They strive to make you very comfortable, and the location is the best part! This mid PDC beach hotel gives you so many options in quick walking distance. I would say everything from the ferry to Coz to most of 5th Aveshopping/dining to even the Mega are within 10 minutes walk. The beds on the great sandy beach are nice, and the food and drinks are good but pretty pricy. We opted to eat and get drinks from Playa Maya next door and carry it to our bed on the beach. As for chosing the right hotel, the rooms are small with little storage and I do not know how this place prices to similar properties nearby frankly. Also, the siste propert Mosqito Blue seems every bit as nice, and only you can decide if the price jump is worth being directly on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good in pictures but very non-fuctionable”
Reviews.Author: Jimandcheryl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Mosquito Beach and we were disappointed. Having seen the hotel many times and loving the location, we finally decided to spend the expensive price and give the hotel a try. First let me say, the hotel looks great in the pictures and even looks good when you see the rooms, but facilities are very un-fuctionable (I hope that's a word). Our problems were the floors were made with wood strips that were screwed in, but the screws are backing out, thus you can really tear up you feet on the screws. Next, the toilets are square, literally. The square, thin rimmed toilet seat make you feel like you are sitting on a bucket. Next, the bathroom and shower are smaller than if you were on a cruise ship. It may sound minor, but you do not even have room to store your toothbrush. On the positive side, you are right on the beach. Unfortunately, they have planted palm trees and obstructed the views from most of the rooms. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. The bellmen were always available and even made the extra effort to anticipate needs. The restaurant staff however, missed the hospitality class that the front desk staff must have received. Overall, I think the front desk staff and bellmen were great, the restaurant staff were arrogant and slow and the design of the hotel poor. The prices are on the very high end for Playa, but location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Waaay too overpriced for what you get - deserves a low star rating”
Reviews.Author: tylerette
Reviews.Content: I cannot emphasize this enough - do NOT let them give you the Deluxe rooms that face the street. The "Deluxe" rooms here are a total misnomer. These rooms are absolutely the tiniest rooms I've ever seen, and there is NO view of the beautiful pool or the beach (as the photos on Travelocity or Orbitz would lead you to believe). I've been traveling to Playa 2-3 times a year for the past 4 years, and I usually stay at the Blue Parrot Suites. This time around, I thought I'd try something different. We ended up paying $200/night for a dark little hotel room with a broken door lock, a broken tv remote control (not like we were inside that much, but still), a dark little shower, and a malfunctioning a/c. There was free wi-fi, but it was super slow. You're better off going to the little cafe on 5th between 8th and 10th and getting wifi from them. There is no possible way I would ever, ever, EVER stay here again. The upside was that overall, besides the hotel, it was a wonderful trip as usual - Playa never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “"Fabulous Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl41651
Reviews.Content: This is hotel if fabulous. Amazing locaton, step out of your room and your on the beautiful beach! Service at this hotel is amazing. Great Food, Great Atmosphere. Lovely Boutique Hotel, Very Cool. Steps away from 5th ave... great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Mosquito Beach Deserves Higher-Ranking on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: BTCS05
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I booked Mosquito Beach and I was not disappointed. I'm just going to repeat a lot of positive and some negative opinions from previous reviews. The location is perfect! You can't ask for more: you are on the beach and and just a half block away from a strip of shops and dining with many-many great selections. The hotel is modern and stylish. We stayed in a junior suite for 7 days. The size of the bedroom is ok, the bathroom could be a little bigger. Some people complains about storage space, let me tell you, I love to overpack and I still had enough room to put my clothes away in the closet. I slept like a baby in the comfy king size bed. Yes, the room is dark, I definitely wouldn't mind a lighter color on the walls. During my stay was a full house and the property was still nice 'n quiet. Lunch and drinks are excellent. I was not crazy about breakfast. I loved the beds on the beach, they are free for hotel guests. Service at front desk, beach club and housekeeping was great, they really made our stay enjoyable. If I could book their Mosquito Beach Suite or Ocean View Suite next time I go back that would make my stay perfect. I checked out other boutique hotels in the area during my stay and overall I highly recommend Mosquito Beach. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, I took a chance and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: ACMIA
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews I was skeptical since they were pretyy bad. But the pictures and the location was so great I took a chance and I dont regret it. The hotel is contemporary boutique hotel. quiet but in the heart of Playa del carmen where all the hot spots are. it is right at the beach too and beacuse the hotel is boutique style (small and intimate), you have access right as you go out your room.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get over feeling nickled and dimed... it was nice”
Reviews.Author: RohreringTimes
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel and the reservation manager, Patricio was so unorganized, not nice or customer oriented. I cannot stress how unaccommodating he was... and since he had gotten our reservation incorrect, it took over 3 hours and a lot of paper work to fix it over the phone as he would not walk down the street to do it in person. It was hard to enjoy the hotel and are stay starting off in such a negative way. That being said, I recommend that you consider staying at the cheaper hotel Mosquito Blue that is on the strip and then head over to Mosquito Blue to use the beach facilities as they are the same owner. The staff was kind and the location was good. The hotel was cool looking. The rooms were loud as you could hear every noise. The pool was dead as the beach was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service / perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TX_travel_987
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of negative reviews on this site, I must say I was a bit nervous booking my stay at Mosquito Beach hotel. But fear not, because this is a truly special property. If you value a unique hotel experience, personal and responsive service, and great value with a superb location, Mosquito Beach is for you. The entire staff , from front desk, to restaurant/bar, to housekeeping, each took great interest in providing friendly and efficient service. Any questions or requests were immediately addressed, right down to the front desk manager bringing maintenance personnel to our room within minutes of reporting a lamp malfunction (it was promptly replaced). Food at the beach club was delicious (don't pass up the ceviche), with generous portions and inexpensive pricing (scratching my head at other comments about overpriced food/drinks??). Admittedly, the rooms are small and have limited storage, but I wasn't in Playa to sit in my room ... I was there for the beach. And how much storage does one really need for swimwear and shorts? To cap it off, the hotel is perfectly located -- one can literally walk a few steps from guest room to the beach and likewise, just a few steps up the street to Avenida 5, where all the dining, drinking and shopping in Playa awaits. A truly enjoyable stay that I will repeat very soon!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect get away from it all...”
Reviews.Author: csr_texas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Playa and stayed at the Mosquito Beach hotel. All I can say is what a great experience! My friend and I arrived on Saturday afternoon and were relaxing on the beach within minutes of our arrival. The reception desk was courteous as well as very friendly. The few concerns we had were addressed immediately, i.e., couldn't figure out the safe and had difficulties figuring out how to turn on the bi-level shower. Each time we left or returned to the hotel we were greeted by name and asked if we needed anything or if we enjoyed our day. The beach beds are spacious and comfortable and the spa-esque music is very relaxing. Hard to believe the hotel is a short block from the busy avenida 5. The staff at the beach club was excellent. They were prompt in taking our orders for beverages and when asked would recommend items on the menu for lunch or a snack. The food is outstanding, and the portions generous, and perhaps the best ceviche I've ever had. The staff was always helpful by suggesting restaurants for our dinners. Our first night we dined at the sister property the Mosquito Blue and had a fabulous dinner. As expected, the room is small and dark with limited storage space. The beds are comfortable; we kept the room more on the cold side which was very welcomed after spending the day on the beach. It also afforded a very comfortable night sleep. All things told and considered, this was the best vacation ever. I would not have changed a thing, perfect weather, wonderful hotel property, friendly and helpful staff. If you are going to go to Playa and want a boutique hotel experience then I absolutely recommend this hotel!! Will definitely go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: juliechopourian
Reviews.Content: this was my fifth time in playa.....on past trips i have stayed in all inclusives and small boutique hotels. my husband and i stayed at the mosquitoe beach hotel with another couple on this trip. really about the hotel, i have nothing positive to say. I like stark and modern, but this was ridiculous. There was no furniture in the rooms whatsoever other then the bed and the closet was nonexistent....u literally have to live out of your suitcase at this hotel. On top of the aweful rooms, the service was horrific! The hotel was not all that busy, but it would take us an hour or more to get any food (which was itself aweful) at the only restaurant they had. Not only that, but the staff (except for a few staff) were exceptionally rude! Even the manager, Noel, who we voiced our opinions to before we left was beyond rude and uncaring about the situation. All she cared about was the fact that we had payed for our stay. There are so many beautiful hotels on this strip in playa that there is no need to stay in a place such as the Mosquito beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated design-hotel”
Reviews.Author: pettnils
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in may and we really liked it a lot. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were nice but quite dark, breakfast was ok, with not so much to choose from. The best thing about this hotel is that it is really quite, but only a few steps from the centre of the town, and actually on the beach! Quite wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: RaquelCypressTX
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of 5th Ave., We could not asked for more travelling with another couple friends,

Reviews.Title: “Stylish wins over functionality at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRD_YFC
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights in peak season (got a discounted rate) and the room was pretty much what i expected based on reviews... that is - small, and dark, while stylish, intimate and definitely a unique boutique experience. The service is great, the staff are friendly and the Mojitos are awesome. It's up there in price for a location like Playa - but it's serene and peaceful while tucked right smack in the middle of everything. The ergonomics of the rooms is terrible - there's little place to put clothing and nowhere for toiletries; great for travellers who pack light and dont need a big dressing room. I guest the worst thing is that while the music they play in the pool and common areas is ecclectic and funky (Benny Goodman meets Jazz Fusion meets Ultra-lounge) - if you stay around a few days you get pretty sick of the fact it just loops over and over and over ad nauseum. The high speed wifi is intermittent as well - but hey - it's a vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect retreat in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: larsrm
Reviews.Content: 10 days in room 111, in the morning-just jump out in the pool from the balcony ( ground floor!! ) Walk down for breakfast and after that to the lounge area on the beach and wait for the lunch,drinks,wines.... just relax. Then around 5pm back to 111 to relax after a hard day on the beach.... cooling down in the pool , read a book or drink some wine in the sunchairs on the balcony, with lounge music playing in the background -PERFECT!!!!!!! I will recommend Mosquito Beach as the perfect hotel in Playa, friendly staff,room 111-113 is the perfect pool rooms, quiet in the night..... WE WILL COME BACK TO 111 Lars & Gro ( Norway)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: msviserto
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Mosquito Beach with my husband and another couple. On our first trip to Playa Del Carmen we made the mistake of staying in an all-inclusive resort. On this vacation we knew better…an all-inclusive is a complete waste in this great town. My husband and I travel frequently. We felt that Mosquito Beach would suit our taste and we were absolutely correct! This is the place to be on the beach. The staff is overly accommodating, the location is perfect, free wireless, an excellent gym discount (walking distance), awesome pool, and great food. The rooms have ultra stylish decor to match the hotel’s chic “South Beach” vibe. Overall, we had a fantastic experience at this property from beginning to end. If you like great service at a trendy spot, then this hotel will not disappoint! AND, please be sure to make a trip to check out the Cenotes and Alux Restaurant…gorgeous!!!

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience in a hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Castor_10
Reviews.Content: On the first night some people entered laughing into our room at about 12 am when we were already asleep because the hotel mistakenly gave our room to other people. They scared the hell out of us and couldn’t sleep that night. I complained but was never able to talk with the manager. There was no apology whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Bat Cave rooms but”
Reviews.Author: serenityNYC
Reviews.Content: overall the service was great. We had reserved our stay at their other hotel Mosquito Blue but when we arrived they said they were having issues with their AC so they Upgraded us to Mosquito Beach. Gentleman helped us carry our luggage over to the hotel and then after checking in helped us to our room. It is a pretty sexy room, small but big enough for a king or queen size bed. I love dark colors so the room looked very nice but the problem was there wasn't enough lighting in the room and no full size mirror aside from the mirror in the bathroom. We stayed in room 214 and had a balcony facing the street. It was pretty quiet at night, the bar or club across the street was closed and looks like its being renovated or just being replaced with something else. So no noisey drunk people in the middle of the night. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day up to 2x a day. The front desk was always nice and the location of course was awesome. The bed was sort of hard and had fluffy pillows which I loved but I guess some people think they are too fluffy. We did live out of our suitcase for the 4 days we were there, no drawers and barely any hangers for anything. Most of our trip was outside of the hotel, we only came to sleep. One night we were at the bar and was surprised that for 4 drinks we paid nearly 50 dollars for total. It was empty on a sunday night and I thought "maybe this is why!! 50US dollars?!? We didnt go back and decided to just stay drinking on the 5ta ave restaurants and bars. We never got to eat anything since every morning we would run out to do our activities so no opinions on breakfast. Never had breakfast or took advantage of the 10% discount for lunch or dinner that entire time. We never used the beach beds since we preferred getting in the water and only stayed out on the beach for about 2hrs since we get tanned and burned easily. Would I go back to the hotel? Maybe, but I would like to try some other hotels that I saw. But I would recommend the hotel if you just wanna lounge on the beach and be close to everything. The ADO bus terminal is close, beach is down the block and opposite way is 5ta ave which is where all the action is. My girlfriend and I felt safe at Playa and didn't feel any discomfort holding hands or being affectionate in the hotel or at Playa. Gay friendly? I say yes

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beach Bar, great hotel, gay popular, and the best location...”
Reviews.Author: Faumun
Reviews.Content: As a gay couple having travelled to Puerto Vallarta, Mexico 16 times, I can honestly say, that Playa del Carmen, and Mosquito Beach has won us over. The charm, chik'ness, food, and night life rival any city I have been to. We stayed at this property for 8 days, and we loved it. Great beach staff, and well, the cleaning staff were so damn polite, professional and detailed, that we loved them almost as much as any of the other. The beach bar with it's oversized beds, amazing drinks, and cheap food, was the place to be seen. No need to travel to the GAY beach, Mosquito Beach was well balanced, totally gay friendly, and well, full of Canadians and Europeans. We met Spanish, French, and Italians throughout our stay. PS. The beach bar attracted beautifull people....and the music was so BEACH HED KANDI and MODERN HOUSE...

Reviews.Title: “THE PLACE in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Luti2000
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel. It is definetely the spot to be at the beach. Overall the hotel design is great. Direct access to the beach (wonderful) with confortable beds and a staff always wanting to serve you. Enjoy your breakfast there! Donnot expect any animation, this is not an all-inclusive. Beeing aware from others reviews, we confirm that the rooms were really small and sombre. The colors are not ideally choosen and there is no body mirrow. In fact not the best choice to create a room for a beach hotel. Mosquito is sytlish, relaxed an in the middle of Playa's leisure activities.

Reviews.Title: “Did NOT get room booked and treated poorly”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Reserved and was guaranteed in an email two-nights in a pool facing deluxe room. Arrived and was told at check in by a RUDE clerk that we were only booked for one night and the hotel was fully booked. I showed the clerk (who should be working a rope line at a trendy club) my reservation and he mumbled something. No apology for their error. We were then brought to our REAR facing no view room. I returned to the lobby to complain about the non-view room and was told pool view was "requested" and not "guaranteed" even though I had a PRINT OUT of an email guaranteeing a pool room. I received no apology or rate break or free breakfast or a drink. The place is a SCAM. After this check in we went to the hotel's sister restaurant for a free cocktail or beer with a coupon that was in our room. We ordered a beer and margarita. We left 50 pesos and the coupon and were chased by a waitress insisting that we owed much more because only ONE SPECIAL cocktail was free with coupon. The coupon said NO SUCH THING. We prevailed after a fight with the manager. Hotel is a rip off SCAM and staff is rude.

Reviews.Title: “A little late but I needed to write this review”
Reviews.Author: KJKSOHO
Reviews.Content: We went to Mosquito Beach for our holiday vacation last year. We arrived at the hotel very late at night and they took us to our cave of a room. It was pretty small but I'm used to that with boutique type of hotels, Delano, Shore Club, Le Serano St Barths, the real issue was the lighting and color paint they used on the walls. I'm on a beach vacation I don't expect the rooms to have grey walls and to top it off the only lights in the room had red lap shades. I could go on and on but lets get to the good part the following morning we woke to pounding on the ceiling. When I called the font desk they acted like I was nuts, it wasn't until I got out of bed and made a scene that they finally admitted to some construction going on the property and next door. Well they finally moved us after my third trip to the front desk, and nothing short of me blowing up. Ahh after all that we finally got to rest in another bat cave of a room. Lets get to the good part though the location is great, the beach is nice. The beds on the beach are fantastic! The service on the beach was good also, they kept my liver very happy all day. We also ate lunch there a few times and the food was good. We ended up going out every night for dinner and the area is a lot of fun. I really want to go back to Playa again this year but I wont being saying at that hotel again, and it really all comes down to the dark rooms that just don't cut it. I want starky white clean looking trendy rooms,. Even Batman got to go upstairs and sleep in a nice room after hanging out in the bat cave.

Reviews.Title: “Our laptop got stolen from the room!”
Reviews.Author: niyatiparekh
Reviews.Content: My husbdand and I stayed at the Mosquito Beach from April 6th to 8th. At first the hotel seemed nice and we felt we had made the right choice of staying in Playa rather than one of the larger resorts outside of town, On hindsight this was the worst decision ever because out laptop and camera were stolen from the room when we were out for dinner the first night. We discovered only in the morning that our things had disappeared. The hotel checked the room to see for forced entry and they checked the camera but did not come up with anything, The hotel has construction going on, yet the security only comes in at 11pm! We also saw that there was a ladder placed next to our first floor room balcony., yet the manager claimed that he did not see anything unusual in the security tapes. But then he said that it was a dark and difficult to see... then why is the camera there in the first place if it does not give a clear visiual. The hotel did not help us beyond that and just said that they were sorry and we should file a police complaint if we want to take the matter further. The robbers also attempted to open the safe but failed. We only found this out only at the time of checkout coz there were minibar charges... for things we hadnt even consumed! The whole incident really shook us up as we realised what an unsafe place we had stayed at. Never again will we stay in such hotels that cannot guarantee guests their safety. Btw.. the room next to us was also broken into but they luckily didnt have anything missing. np

Reviews.Title: “OK HOTEL. BUT OVERPRICED AND ROOMS ARE MUCH SMALLER THAN THE WEBSIGHT PORTRAYS”
Reviews.Author: drmjrdc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Mosquito Beach in April 2009 for 5 days. I booked what I was led to believe from the website the 2nd best room they had. It was not. For over $300 a night, we recieved a tiny dark downstairs room with la ow ceiling. i immediately went up front and the the next day was moved to a room upstairs, the same size, but a better view with a higher ceiling. Neither rooms look anything like the website. The staff was pleasant..but the beach area was very crowded with people that are not guests. The waiters grab toursits from the beach and pile matresses end to end on top of you to make more money. also, they were doing loud construction at the beachside bar for our first 3 days. NO ONE APOLOGIZED TO US!!! Look, this isnt a bad hotel.Its trendy, on the beach, and in the middle of town. But for $1800 for 5 days, plus they charge you in US dollars and convert to pesos at a crappy rate, I would tell my friends to go elsewhere..its just not worth it..a friend of mine stayed at a place called the Tree top, for $80 a night, and it was fine..then you can walk to mosquito beach and just use the facilities..if you want a really nice hotel..we met people staying at the Royal..all inclusive, close to downtown..and at the end of the day with food, drinks, big room and jacuzzi in the room..it was around $400 a day..i think i would stay there if i wanted a really nice placed...do not stay at this hotel!!!. its way way over priced..the websight is a hoax. to close, im pretty laid back person..i dont need the absolute best, i just feel i was mislead and I dont want other people to get ripped off by these people like i did. look around..playa is an AWESOME place to vacation..my girlfriend and i had an absolute blast..the French restauarant across from Mosquito Beach was great, romantic, trendy, and quiet..especially for younger couples who want to party AND relax..theres a ton of beach bars and the tour combination of Tulum ruins and Xel-Ha waterpark was great..go to Plays..skip Mosquito Beach

Reviews.Title: “5 Star location with 1 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: COtourist
Reviews.Content: Great location with clean and trendy rooms. It is similar to a W on the Beach in an ideal location. However, the service here and at there sister hotel (Mosquito Blue) is horrendous. They don't seem to care about the perception of their service and believe their hotel is so unique they can drop the service levels. My fiance and I have stayed here many times because of the location but are done with it b/c of the service. The front desk will have a slicked back young guy that should be bouncing a bar that considers you lucky to be staying at the property and finding out about the hotel. We have been down here many times and this perception is widely shared..."unfortunate because of the location and cool property." Apparently the owners manage from a distance and are not concerned about making changes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBellaNYC
Reviews.Content: Went with Friends ( 4 girls). It is super clean and the beach is steps away. The Loacation is awesome. The shops, restaurants, clubs, are 1/2 a block from the hotel. We went to a beach party that was 2 hotels down and the nightlife is incredible. Yes, the rooms are dark, with no shelves and no long mirror which was hard for us girls when getting ready. The bed is very comfortable and the beach beds/chairs are unique, I loved them. Please if you go, just keep in mind that you are not getting a luxury room with all the amenities, though i was surprised to find designer soap and shampoo, would rather they spent that money on a long mirror for the room and better lighting. The staff is wonderful. If you are looking for a Hotel on the beach and close to lots of activity, then this is the place. If you are looking for a romantic getaway then go to a resort away from the hustle and bustle. Note: do not waste time signing up at the airport for tours and going to a time share meeting. We found that the Hotel offered tours for just a few dollars more w/o the hassle of attending a 3 hour presentation

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared off by the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: hansentj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I became very nervous after booking our stay at MB and then viewing the TripAdvisor reviews. However, those fears were put to rest almost immediately after arriving. The common complaints from other reviews are not entirely unfounded. The rooms are small. They are also dark, lack storage space and have impractical toilets. But the hotel more than made up for those minor faults with its fantastic location and chic atmosphere. The grounds are immaculately kept and the rooms are cleaned to the highest standards daily. The front desk service was absolutely top flight and always performed with a smile. My wife and I, anticipating the difficulty of carrying on phone conversations in Spanish, asked the concierge to help us with some booking details and they were always happy to do so. The location of MB stands out as perhaps its greatest asset. Our room was literally ten steps from the front door to the sand of the beach but it always had a welcome sense of privacy whenever we wanted to get away. Furthermore, the hotel is just half a block from the main walking mall of PDC. The beach service that the hotel provided was friendly and usually timely. Also, the hotel provides beach mattresses to lie on which are comfortable and perfect for snuggling with your partner as you sip a drink. If you don't speak Spanish, don't worry, pretty much every staff member of MB speaks excellent English. Is MB spendy? Yes. Does it have some flaws? Yes. But by and large the reviews I have read of this hotel are off base in my opinion. The shortcomings of the hotel are not vacation-killers (hell, they barely registered on the radar and I probably wouldn't have thought twice about them had I not read about them in the reviews). The strengths of the hotel are some of the reasons why our recent vacation to PDC was so great. One of the best pieces of advice my wife and I read regarding vacationing is "know yourself." Meaning, know what you want. Are you looking for a trendy atmosphere with a killer location? Mosquito Beach is the place for you. Are you looking for quiet, empty beaches and a large hotel room? Look elsewhere. Side note, If you are certified to dive, don't miss the Cenote diving in the area, it is not to be missed (and go with Mexico Blue Dream).

Reviews.Title: “Mosquito Beach Review”
Reviews.Author: jvhinojosa
Reviews.Content: I booked an ocean room view for 6 nights to celebrate our first anniversary. The cost was $333 US or a little over $2,000 US dollars. The room we were promised (206) was great as it had an ocean view and on the 2nd floor. The hotel looked nice and we couldn't wait to get into the room, but it wasn't ready. When we returned we were told the room was not available and we had to wait another hour for another room to be cleaned. We were not happy. The room we had (204) was very small, dark, the air conditioner leaked, the sink in the bathroom leaked and it was not worth the money we paid at all. The room smelled like rotting wood and we woke up with colds. The waiters were VERY RUDE and not helpful at all. The beach equipment was booked by people not even staying at our hotel. I would not stay here again. It's very overpriced and not worth the money. I would rate this a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LIZZYHEURTE
Reviews.Content: This place is the worst hotel experience I have ever had. We are regular travelers and take at least 2 or 3 trips per year. We stay in 4 to 5 star hotels normally. This place is a 1 star disguised as a 4 star!!!!! The place is sub par in every aspect. This hotel ruined our vacation, and this has never happened to us anywhere else. We were sold on a luxury boutique hotel and the pictures on the website certaintly indicated this. When we arrived, we knew we had been duped. The place is severly run down. IT smells like humidity. The wood floor is filled with rusted nails. The wood on our balcony was peeling. The hallway to our room smelled like humidity, worst than a lockeroom! We stayed in a junior suite and the shower was smaller than what I have had in cruises. The place was simply unacceptable! When we wen to the beach, they had no fresh towels. The excuse was they were sooo busy, no time to wash them! The bathroom in the restaurant did not have a look and smelled worst than a locker room! I could not believe the state of the place. We immediately called reservations and let them know that we were not satisfied with the place and we wanted to move hotels. They said this was fine, but that they would have to charge us for the entire 7 night stay. More than 3 thousand dollars!!! We could not believe it. WE argued and argued but it was useless. We decided the place was so bad we were better off moving hotels. However, we were only able to find a hotel that was 20 minuted from Playa del Carmen. Thus, since we were getting charged anyways, we specifically told the people at the MOsquito Beach that we expected our room to be available for the seven days. After all, we were getting charged. We would need a place to change and leave our things when we came into playa. We purposely did not check out,. After a couple of days when we came back to playa, our key did not work. The receptionist gave us a new key a and what a surprise to find our room full of another persons things. Naturally, they had rented out our room to another person! We immediately called reservations and they promised to reimburse us for 100% of our money by Monday.We had to change in the employees bathroom, and I cannot overstate the bad state that was in. Overall a terrible experience. O Monday, when we called they told us that we had misunderstood and that they would only refund 2 nights. What happen is they purposely lied to us so we would not create a scene and ask for our room back!! We talked to everyone at the hotel including the manager, who told us that we were lucky to get a 2 night refund! We are still waiting for this refund and I am already losing hope that this will happen. There low level of professionalism and just outright lying to clients. All of it is very disturbing and upsetting. When we were waiting at the hotel for an answer, one of the young men that worked there confessed to us that the hotel messed up often that that he was already looking for another job!! Avoid this place like the plague. We are investigating how to put a formal complaint against this hotel with the tourism authorities.

Reviews.Title: “People that loved the MB is because they don't know what customer service means”
Reviews.Author: real_traveller2009
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Playa and absolutely loved our vacation. But Mosquito Beach Hotel .. that's a different story. Before i start my lenghty review, let me tell you who I travelled with, so you can have a better perspective of what we were expecting from this hotel. I went there with my bf , my brother and 3 of his closest friends. We are all in our early 30's, we are all pretty active, loved great food and wine, we are into travelling to luxurious and exotic locations, as well as budget destinations, we love to rest but also to party and hang out with other peeople, and we have travelled pretty much all over the world. All of this makes me think that the people who loved Mosquito Beach is because they do not know what service level means, or are bedazzled by the description of the hotel in their website or just thought they stayed in a so called chic exclusive place ... but let me tell you, MB is none of the above. Where to start? * Rooms: My boyfriend and I booked a White Sand (partial ocean view, Bvlgary ammenities, plasma TV, kind size bed, beautiful italian furniture, spacious room, balcony, etc .. the list is long) what we got NO PARTIAL OCEAN VIEW, but a garden view (beware, ALL WHITE SAND ROOMS are located in the same building and NONE has ocean view, not even some of the 700 USD master suites have ocean view !!!!!) When we complaint, they said, this is "partial ocean view, you can walk to the beach from here and see it through the gardens". We got an obscure, and not chic atmosphere, pretty disfunctional room, no bed side tables, no cabinets to store your clothes, not enough hangers, not enough light, (not even for make up or male's shaving processes) the whole room smelled like urine because of the humiddity (they didn't built it properly) and the "beautiful wooden floors" were so cheap that they cracked open in both, our terrace and inside the room just by walking on it !!!! The "art pieces" weren't art at all (they paint it themselves and hang it on the walls!!!), the italian furniture ... we found the place where they built them near Playa del Carmen!!! As for the ammenities, they provided us with shampoo, gel de douche and one soap (for both the sink and shower), so when you ask for more soap, it's a big deal (since they are Bvlgari, and they dont want to "waste" them ..) and they WONT gave us conditioner nor lotion, nor any of the other ammenities and if u forgot your tootbrush or something else, good luck on the store pal!! And this is a 368 - 460 USD room !!! My brother and his friends all booked Sunrise rooms (the descriptions were almost the same, except that there were double beds instead of king size) what they got was a tinny room with two single beds (where in the world, when you book a double room you get individual beds rather than double beds? nowhere but Mosquito Beach!!! and for 312-390 USD) and a tinny TV plasma and the same problems we found in our room.... Later on, my brother decided to check out an upgrade to a Brezze room (aprox 40 USD more) just to find out that it was EXACTLY HIS SAME room, but with a king size bed .... * Food - absolutely awful and way overpriced. The waiters are rude too and expect a lot of tip. The minibar is pretty overpriced as well. The restaurant and room service only runs from 7:30 am to 4:30 pm, so beware of this .. * Beach club - who has black day beds on the beach ???? because it's chic??? what about comfort? what about the fact you're frying your skin on those? shouldn't those be white or so??? the beach club IS PACKED !!!! not enough day beds for all customers AND they rent those for customers outside of the hotel. One of the main purposes we decided to stay at MB was because of such exclusive luxurious beach club .. well you can stay somewhere else and still have access to it !!! (MB is one of the ONLY hotels in Playa that allows non-customers to enjoy its beach club) Actually there are plenty of hotels that have beach clubs next to MB, and are less crowded. The beach itself wasn't what we expected, since it was destroyed a few years back after Hurricane Wilma and it's not a white sand beach anymore, but you can still find some spots that aren't as bad as MB's beach is. * Pool area: absolutely small, and packed. * Construction: they were providing maintenance INSIDE the hotel the ENTIRE time of our vacation .. fixing doors, painting ceilings and walls, welding a roof, etc .... even in our terrace!!! (one morning we woke up by this terrible noise just to find a guy in our private terrace welding something), when we complaint, management said: no worries, they will only work on it today and tomorrow !!!! [-]!!!! * Concierge service: completely unexistant. * Parking for rental cars: unexistant as well. * Gym/Sport facilities: unexistant. * Airport transfers: Beware. When i booked it, they were very anal about getting every detail for both flights, and since i wasn't sure about the departure information, or whether we were going to need it, they advice me to book the round service with the premise that i could cancel later the return transfer or modify the information, and when i tried to do so with 3 days in advance they gave me a simply NO, you have to pay for it entirely, and no changes are allowed. * Management obviously doesn't know what they are doing, and they are only ripping people off and taking advantage of their location. But the worse is that whenever they screw up, they don't even apologize !!!! We were bothered in two occasions about huge bills (1,000 US and 600 USD) that we didn't know what they were coming from !!!! and had to spend some time clarifying such. Inconvenient hassle you don't need when on vacation .. * Beware of the exchange rate !!!! Most places have it between 13 and 13.5 pesos for a dollar. This place is 14, but the tricky part is that they charge your bill in dollars, and in order to avoid this you have to pay in US dollars cash, otherwise, they will convert your bill in dollars to pesos at THEIR exchange rate, and then charge it to your credit card. My advice is to stay in one of the following places: (much better, and not such a major rip off, with access to the same beach) * Corto Maltes condos * The Royal Playa del Carmen * Hotel Real Playa * Pueblito Escondido Hotel OR if you wanna splurge and keep the same level of service that you expect from a 500 USD room hotel then stay at: * Mayakoba Fairmont * Grand Velas Riviera Maya * Secrets (for honey mooners) Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place”
Reviews.Author: valann38
Reviews.Content: Staff on the beach were unfriendly. The waiter was angry because we didn't order enough food and drinks and he said he couldn't make tips that way. We took a walk on the beach and when we returned our bag had been stolen. This occurred right after the waiter was very rude and said "How can I make money?" Others on the beach said he was hanging around our chairs when the bag was stolen. Don't trust the beach waiters. Keep your things secure!

Reviews.Title: “Miss You Mosquito =(”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanLaura
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband just arrived home and we are missing mosquito beach, we spend 1 week at the hotel, Playa del Carmen is one of my favorite places to go, and we want it to stay in the town that's why we choose Mosquito Beach Hotel, the staff always treated us like family, the room was fabulous, always clean, square toilettes from italy :o, plasma tv's, Mini-Fridge. We had a romantic champagne at the balcony, we just don't have any complain about the hotel, we definetely stay here again. Laura Michigan, USA

Reviews.Title: “Totally Chic”
Reviews.Author: JoseVazquez
Reviews.Content: Well This is My Story! The first impression of the hotel it's incredible, it's the only boutique & small hotel in the area, the difference between this and all the hotels around is huge, the guys @ the frontdesk there are so kind and helpful, the rooms are great (small but gorgeous) there's a beach club with sunbeds, lounge chairs, and also the food is great, the pool is extremely relaxing in my next trip to mexico, mosquito definitely it's my home

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Napoli99
Reviews.Content: First of all we need to say that mosquito beach it's the only boutique and small hotel on the beach in the whole city, i booked this hotel because i like to walk right on the town, even that the hotel is beautiful, all the lamps, beds, tables there are from italy, about the last review's from the noise, i didnt have troubles with that, it's not so loud, the staff it's always trying to help you, the guys on the restaurant so helpfull too, if you are coming for bussiness like me, you can enjoy a good coffee on the restaurant with a nice beach, wi-fi (restaurant & frontdesk), and the best thing a relaxing stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but overpriced (Note their exchange rate!!!)”
Reviews.Author: Matti T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mosquito beach for a week at the begining of April 2008 and it is not all it seemed from the site. The location in Playa and the beach club are good, but food and beverages are very overpriced. The rooms are nice, but with limited sea view and there is a strong smell of mildew, the rooms are also darker than seen in pictures - a bit of a let down. The service is ok, you don't get much for the price you pay for the rooms. All and all we liked it, but not more, would not go there again. Please note!! the Mosquito Hotels use US$/Pesos exchnage rate of 1US$ : 11.5 Pesos, which is about 15% higher then anywere else around town, we did not notice it on their confirmation e-mail and as we did not have all of the amount in cash we ended up paying by credit card and noticed the price was 15% higher!!! no one said anything at time of payment (we could have used a local ATM and paid in US$ saving a couple hundred $). PAY ATTENTION TO THIS KIND OF MANAGMENT TRICKS.

Reviews.Title: “MAJOR RIP-OFF!”
Reviews.Author: skoobalover
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Mosquito Beach, Play del Carmen. We loved Playa del Carmen but HATED Mosquito Beach. First of all, it is WAY OVERPRICED! Do your homework (which we did not) and you will find that this place charges FAR MORE than any other property in the area - including beach front luxury places. We decided to splurge on ourselves so we went for the suite with an ocean view...which is more than we wanted to spend, but we figured it must be pretty luxurious for that price and were willing to upgrade to have the beautiful view that they advertise for that room. Well, it turns out that when we got there they said that we were in the OTHER suite - the one with a view of the pool and the street, but for the same price. We were very unhappy and told them that we specifically had requested the room that is advertised as having the ocean view - they first denied that we specifically requested the one with the view, but later (when we showed them the confirmation email noting the ocean view suite) acknowledged it but said there was nothing they could do about it now because it was booked. Well, the other suite was not even a suite - just one large room with a slight alcove (the size of a chair) that overlooks the pool. Its just a bigger room but a lot of wasted space. And it smelled like mildew (or urine). The furniture was uncomfortable and the whole room was very dark and dreary (dark brown walls, dark wood floors, poor lighting, dark curtains). Funky, but not what we were hoping for with a beach vacation. Not to mention that there really were no amenities - there is a nice beach club but even there the service was poor, and the place did not have much in terms of concierge service that you would expect from a plce where you are paying $500 a night! Well, the worse part of it all was that when we told them that we were unhappy about their mix up with the room and made it clear that the ONLY reason we booked the suite was for the ocean view, not because we needed a suite - and despite the fact that they acknowledged they messed up - they did NOTHING to compensate us or apologize, etc. By the way, we found a really nice place two blocks over that has two bedroom apartments with kitchens and an ocan view and rooftop deck (private) that rents for $270 a night! (I think it is called Corto Maltes) - had we seen it early enough we would have switched places but we did not see it until our last night there! My advice - there are TONS of nicer places on this beautiful island (which, by the way, despite the hotel, the island is one of my favorite places in the world) - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool 4 Me”
Reviews.Author: ElRey99
Reviews.Content: Well there too many bad reviews about this property, but like me titles it says, it was cool 4 me, one thing is truth there's a construction next door, but it's in the left side from the hotel most of the rooms there are next to the beach and it's not so loud, my room it was fine 203 a junior suite w/balcony, this kind of hotel is like the new europpean hotels with amazing architecture amazing furniture, also the beach club is great you can take a sunbed(for free) and charge food & drinks to your room, the people @ the frontdesk is really helpful, the last thing that i did it was a relaxing massage in the other property(mosquito blue) Thank U Mosquito Beach (My recommendation if you want to have some sun and take a piña colada with style come to this hotel is the best in all the area)

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: notsopickytraveller
Reviews.Content: definitely one of the worst hotels I have stayed at for the price. gloomy rooms, cheap quality furniture and fixtures, useless front desk and room service, loud construction, overall it was absolutely terrible. My advice to anyone considering staying here: Don't make the mistake!!

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Travel5555
Reviews.Content: Good location with average service. I liked the open-aired reception area/front desk. But, The modern / minimalist architecture and interior design ran amok and stood in stark contrast to the surrounding culture, look, and feel and eclipsed functionality. This could possibly be crafted into a unique and beneficial attribute. However, an extreme lack of light and very small size of the guest rooms and baths left all of us wishing for something better. The room keys were black and if you set them down you might have to request another as they are quite difficult to find in the dark. Few lamps and fewer electrical outlets, and NO furniture with a drawer or bedside tables leave you with few options but to leave your clothes and personal items strewn about the floor. The square-shaped toilet is really fun to look at but you don't want to use it. The very small shower with overhead vs wand sources of water are difficult at best to operate especially with wet hands. Don't get me wrong, Play Del Carmen is spectacular, but the archictural theme of this property has taken precedence to comforts and conveniences expected in an average hotel. I have visited this area before and had an amazing hotel experience. Construction is underway at the property as of March 2008 and looks as if it will continue for at least another 6-9 months. Jackhammers begin early as of this writing. Final comment, it seems all rooms do not take advantage of the ocean front location of the property with the room/balcony views facing inward into the courtyard. Bottom line, just a nice place to sleep (although pricey for this type of niche), while enjoying Playa Del Carmen. Also, limited views and guest room ambient lighting is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and Overprized”
Reviews.Author: Alexdelen
Reviews.Content: For 280€ a night to have a good hotel. Well our experience was totally different. First day we arrived our room was late. We had to wait like 2 hours before our rooms was ready. A nice surprise were the construction works next doors. Noise started around 7:30am till 6pm. We tried to talk to the manager. At first front desk personnel told us that it was normal to have that noise and that we should not harass the manager with that. After some time the manager was on holidays and would not be back before the end of our trip. So they actually told us if we wanted we could use a room in the mosquito blue or just cope with it. Rooms: well small, no space for luggage but some nice design. A little moist due to high humidity but normal I think. Positive but a bathtub would be nice. Hotel: they had a nice architect. Beware of the breakfast that should be all inclusive. Totally not. You have a daily 10$ credit for your breakfast per person. So you will pay your orange juice every morning. Any other demand will be charged and you’ll get a response from the personnel ‘what the heck are you asking me again’. Also breakfast choices are limited to eggs, eggs, eggs, fruit, toast with jam and 2 cups coffee. No more. Please take your time when you’ll have your breakfast and don’t be surprised to order fried eggs with bacon and receive an omelet with mushrooms and ham. Best thing for the Mosquito beach is its location a nice view from the breeze rooms. Right on the beach and in the center of 5th av. The evening shift of the bar/restaurant is the opposite of the morning shift. Food is really good and the barmen are funny. We spent 10 nights over there with 3 couples. They all complained about the noise and the morning moods of the personnel. Rude responses are a common activity over there. Recommendation: Don’t go there to have a nice calm holiday works will continue for some time. You will have a nice drilling sound as wakeup call, you will be asking morning personnel 5 times after your eggs or ketchup or toast, and front personnel that are left alone with no manager. If you go to Mosquito beach well do it for the location and architecture, but there are some other nice hotels next doors and cheaper. it’s my first time in all my travelling time I write a review, but this one was really worth it. Regards Alex

Reviews.Title: “Beware of theft”
Reviews.Author: sharzLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Throughout the stay we were very careful to leave our valuables in the safe that the hotel provides in the rooms. Upon checkout they provided us with a "security room" to put our luggage in while we were waiting for airport transportation. This "security room" as it was called was really their laundry room. We put our camera in the backpack and when we returned we noticed the camera missing. We also noticed that the door in the laundry room was open to the public streets....wide open! In addition there were many employees in the laundry room with our bags and also bus boys working for the hotel that we had never seen before walking all around our luggage.. How can they call this a security room?? We complained to the hotel manager who could really care less about our situation. She offered no explanation why the room was open to the public or why so many different employees had unsupervised access to our luggage. This is overall a good hotel. VERY small rooms, no closet or vanity space at all.!! dont expect anything from the actual room. The location and beach front staff is the best part of this hotel. Keep an eye out for your valuables during your stay, and don't make any requests from the hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “Location great - hotel not so great”
Reviews.Author: K10L
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. The hotel is located in the best part of town and has a great beach and awesome trendy vibe to it. It's true that you're not in your room much which is probably why I don't mind that there were a few problems. It is true what everyone says - the rooms are extremely dark and smell so musty. There is only one mirror in the entire room and that's in the bathroom. There needs to be another mirror in the room. The shower leaked everytime we took a shower... the air conditioning kept breaking down but it was a quick fix. One night we went to take showers and there was a pipe broken in the hotel so we had to walk a couple blocks to mosquito blue to take a shower. I think the worst part of the trip was when we looked at our bed and there were ants all over the sheets!!! The service was good.. they took care of each problem quickly. We got compensated as well for the issues that happened. I loved loved the beach there and the location was perfect. If i went back again i might suggest staying at mosquito blue where i heard the rooms are nicer , brighter and you still get use of the mosquito beach club. Playa is great and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Luxury Boutique”
Reviews.Author: WhereTotoReallyWent
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, adults-only, contemporary-luxury boutique hotel, look no further… Mosquito Beach is centrally located and with in a short walking distance of numerous restaurants, bars, and shops. The Staff… The staff went above and beyond our expectations. The waiters remembered our coffee, breakfast, and drink preferences and their greetings brought smiles to our faces each day. Before we finished breakfast, our lounge chairs were reserved and awaiting our arrival on the beach. The staff also provided excellent suggestions for places to eat and knew which dance clubs to go to on any given night. The Rooms… Okay, so the rooms aren’t 800 square foot palaces, but there is more than plenty of room to move around comfortably. The showers are phenomenal, as are the designer skin/hair products they provide for you. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The three gripes we had were: no dressers, a very small bathroom sink vanity, and only one small mirror in the room. That said - we managed quite nicely and those “gripes” had very little impact on our wonderful stay. The Food… We had coffee and ate breakfast on the beach every morning. The breakfast choices (eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt, etc.) were quite delicious. We ate lunch at the hotel twice and the food was good. If it weren’t for the enormous selection of restaurants within walking distance, we would have eaten more meals at the hotel. The Beach… The hotel has a private beach and provides lawn and lounge chairs for the guests. The lounge chairs have individual sunshades, handy for sleeping or reading books. The beach was clean (no trash or seaweed), the water was clear, you could wade out a long way, and there was no coral or seaweed in sight. The hotel is close enough to walk to the pier, yet far enough away to not hear the boats or smell their exhaust and fumes. The Weather… Well…we were there in late January… Several of the days the sun came out and we were able to bask in its warmth…but the nights were another story. If you’re planning a trip in January or February, we highly recommend you pack several sweaters and long pants, as it can get quite cold! Despite the cold nights, the hotel was warm and cozy – a definite getaway destination anytime of the year! One hiccup…that turned into a pleasant surprise… Upon arrival, we discovered there was a scheduling mix up and our room would not be available for the first three nights. To make up for the mistake, they offered to upgrade us to a junior suite at their sister hotel (several blocks inland) for those three nights. Having stayed at both locations, we can confidently say that the staff and management have gone out of their way to create a hotel you will enjoy, regardless of which location you choose!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: tmb411
Reviews.Content: Great location in between the beach and 5th avenue. Initially, the rooms look cool...then you realize that they're pretty cramped and lacking in some basic hotel type-stuff, like a dresser. No good place to put clothes. Don't expect to really unpack during your stay, you'll be living out of your suitcase. Food at the beach club was good. The beachclub is the best thing about this place. Nice daybeds and the beach in front of the hotel is the nicest along the strip directly in front of Playa del Carmen. I found the staff to be adequate, but not overly helpful. Our key card to our room worked about half the time...we had to go to the desk no less than 5 times during our stay to have them reset the card. Also, the housekeeper broke my wife's glasses and never mentioned it. Construction next door starts promptly at 7am with loud hammering but a previous review noted, there is a ton of construction in playa right now. Whatever...playa del carmen is a pretty nice place to spend a few days. This is definitely no better than a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: JohnWeis
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just arrived from a trip to playa del carmen, and we walked in to Mosquito Beach, first of all we need to explain that the hotel outside it's gorgeous, and inside it's even better we had a room called White Sand the room was 204 (best room for me) lol, service 100% the girls at the frontdesk so helpfull all the time(24 Hours)whatever you need just call them, all the rooms are facing to the garden and the beach so what else you need?.... the beach club is the best in all the area, we walked around 3 miles at the beach and maramao is for sure the top of them, yummy yummy food, you can call the room service and enjoy the best ceviche in town in your balcony, the construction next door is almost done so don't worry about it they are just painting and put in some furniture so there's no noise in whole day, well my friends enjoy the mosquito beach and please do not book the 204 because that's my room(kidding) John

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but.....”
Reviews.Author: sergel79
Reviews.Content: The previous review was right on the money. Very cool, very euro-trendy place, excellent beach/beach bar/restaurant (prob the nicest on the beach judging from the walking we did). Awsome location with low traffic at night. HOWEVER, the rooms are lacking for the price. They are nice, but small, (there are no room photos on the website because you cannot get an adequate angle to take a pic) and the views are nothing to write home about (there really is no beach view due to the angles/placement of the rooms). Also, they all have real hardwood floors which means you have a 50/50 chance of getting noisey neighbors upstairs that you will hear their walking/coming in late at night. While on the subject of noise, there is a condo complex being buily next door - I'm not a contractor, but realistically, there is at least 3 to 6 months of work left in my opinion. The noise/workers inhibit use of the pool area (unless you like construction workers checking out your girl/wife in her bikini) We spent our days on the beach which was great, but we actually DOWNGRADED our room because the original room was back to back connected to construction project/noise/jack hammering, etc,etc. If you like to sleep in, do not stay here for the next few months. We were up early every day so this was not a problem. Also, the staff decided to have a little "gathering" in the open air lobby our last night (1/13 in case the manager reads this) and were quite noisey keeping us from sleeping.... Summary: nice place, pretty people, good food, no room views, but will eventually remind you why this is a 3 star hotel and not a 4 or 5. Worth checking out but not really sure if I would stay a 2nd time without investigating if there are other options with similar tastes. (also, to be fair, there is construction going on EVERYWHERE, so the noise thing may happen elsewhere, although the staff noise on the last night was inexcusable.)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service EVER”
Reviews.Author: berger_inferno
Reviews.Content: We had nothing but problems at this hotel. Do yourself a favor and stay across the street at the Alhambra. Problems: no water on numerous days, no manager on site, hidden fees and insulting allegations regarding inhabitants. The locale and the beach service were great, but if you're looking for a hotel to accommodate your needs, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Playa's Main Beach”
Reviews.Author: cachoem
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen's main beach is a down to earth, relaxed atmosphere, I have stayed in 2 other hotels in Playa del Carmen, and the Mosquito Beach Hotel is the best hotel on the main beach for the following reasons; 1) Location. It is on the best part of the beach and close to all 2) Service. Very educated staff and quick to respond to needs 3) Rooms. Comfortable, Chic and Very Clean 4) Beach area. Private beach area with beds and lounge chairs, bar and restaurant right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “loved mosquito beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyeskye7
Reviews.Content: we've been going to Cancun for 8 yrs.--we arrive a couple days early & stay elsewhere--most of the yrs. we have stayed in Playa Del Carmen--this was our first stay at Mosquito Beach--I checked out the reviews before we booked it--alot of negitive feedback--we would stay there again in a heartbeat---the staff was great--the location was great--the resturant was great & the beach was great! The rooms are hotel rooms--not big--we had rooms on the pool--great--it was hot---we first booked through expedia--don't do that--they jacked up the price to double--we then booked directly through the hotel for the regular price & every time we emailed the hotel--they responded in a very quick maner--which dosen't happen alot--when your dealing with MX--We highly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Go Back”
Reviews.Author: msmary2
Reviews.Content: Way over priced for a dark and poorly lit space. Room walls painted blackish brown. Wooden floors with dark stain. Terrible lighting. No mirror except one in dark bathroom. Terrible musty smell. Had to buy scented candles to try to get rid of the odor. No wash clothes in hotel. No dresser. No place to put toiletries. Very uncomfortable furniture if you were fortunate to have any. They did keep it clean and the staff was friendly, but certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Shame On Them!!!”
Reviews.Author: ABMUnitedStates
Reviews.Content: We imagine that at some point the owners of Mosquito Beach hotel intended it to be one of a kind Boutique hotel as their web site description and photos suggest. But! that was far from the truth the day we arrived there….. From the moment you walk into the property you realize that it hasn’t received the maintenance it required in-order to match with their web site photos. The common ground is poorly maintained as is every architectural décor! And everywhere you looked around you could spot Rust, rotten wood, burned out light bulbs, dying plants, mildew and a need for fresh paint. Add to that an empty pool! LOAUD noise pollution from a massive condominium construction adjoining the hotel! And we ended up EXTRIMLY disappointed. Further more our room had tiny biting ANTS in our bed! Licking shower doors! Stained bed sheets! (And not at all the 300 count Egyptian cotton as they claim to have on their web site) Plasma TV with a color resolution problem! And elevated panels from what once was possibly a beautiful wooden floor! And as if that wasn’t enough the hotel “Manager” was an absolute embarrassment to the hotel industry profession. She was RUDE and she was AGGRESIVE, to say the list!!!! Perhaps for some people staying at the mosquito beach hotel is an upgrade from everywhere else they might have stayed in the pass. Which of course justify their good reviews on “Trip-Advisor”. But for the rest of us who are used to up scaled accommodations we expect a lot more than what the Mosquito beach hotel delivers

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!... no better option in Playa del Carmen.”
Reviews.Author: FernandaOR07
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel on line and fell in love!! ([--]) Is exactly what I was looking for, I traveled with my husband for our honeymoon and I could not have had a better time. From the time we arrived the treatment was excellent and the room was perfect... We stayed in an ocean view suite, second floor, with a very nice terrace.The room was perfectly clean, the bathroom was amazing. Food is delicious in the beach club and was never to crowded. Staff was always willing to help and very friendly. I would definitely recommend this Hotel, is really you best option!!!. Don't believe the other comments I completely disagree and they seem over exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: mike555nyc
Reviews.Content: Overall it was ok. there really are no beach views so do not believe nor overpay for a so called beach view. basically it is a nice looking hotel, but staff needs to be trained inorder to make your stay great. the cleaning staff are horrible. my room was filthy and they hardly ever brought towels etc. there was a piece of a paper on the floor to the side of the bed that was there when they gave me the room and there when i left. they never bothered to pick it up and throw it away. anyway, for the price its not a bad deal just dont expect great service. as for the beach the other side of the beach by mamitas is much nicer, but here was not bad. the service was good just make sure you ask to be served by pedro. he is the only one who actually pays attention to you and is consistently asking if you need anything. hope this helped...

Reviews.Title: “very chic and met all my demands from its staff”
Reviews.Author: pinva
Reviews.Content: Right away as I arrived, I knew that I was going to like this hotel, very chic and just the right size. The staff did everything possible to make my stay there and in Playa Del Carmen comnfortable and fun. Very attentive and courteous staff. Make sure to book an in-room massage from Pepe. Cesar Perez Falls Church, Virginia USA

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit even better”
Reviews.Author: Chess25
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time that we stayed at Mosquito Beach Hotel and we loved this small and beautiful hotel. I don't understand some of the reviews, the service however was outstanding, everyone worked together to be sure our stay was comfortable. Most of the rooms have a really nice view to the Ocean, The food at the restaurant is delicious, Pedro is sooo helpful. Also they have their sister hotel Mosquito Blue just a few blocks from the Beach. We definitely would like to recomend this resort to everyone. We just can't wait for the third time at Mosquito Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Design & Service”
Reviews.Author: SunHunter169
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from our 5th Aniv. at Mosquito Beach Hotel in Playa del Carmen and we just loved the hotel. We got more than a nice hotel, the people at the Front Desk make you feel at home, all the staff is trying to make your stay a memorable one. About the rooms all the furniture it comes from europe so this make the hotel a really boutique hotel. Best in town. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: ltrevinos
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Playa del Carmen for a long weekend, and chose this hotel because it's right by the beach. When we got there everything seemed nice, but once we got our rooms the power went off, it was the middle of the night, so we could not see anything, it only lasted a few minutes. On our second night, the power went off from 6.00 AM until 12.30 PM, we had no air conditioning and no water in our rooms, to use the bathroom service personnel had to bring water from the pool, we could not shower or brush our teeth. But that wasn't it..., they started repairing the power service at 6.30 AM, which woke us up because of the noise. We were told we were going to be compensated for this problem, which of course did not happen when we were leaving. And that wasn't it, some of our friends were arriving two days later, they had a reservation and the day before their arrival I asked the woman at the front desk if everything was ok, which she confirmed. Once our friends got there, they told them that they couldn't stay there and had them moved to the Mosquito Blue. I guess my friends were lucky, we saw a few more people arrive and presented with the same situation, and since the Mosquito Blue was also full they had to leave with no where to stay, since the hotel staff could not provide them with service at another hotel. The service at the hotel is very poor, we asked to speak to the manager several times, we even saw him at the beach (he is there all the time) but he never even care to come and speak to us.
