Also the service staff at the beach is no good, and that gets worse if you are from Mexico (like us)... you'll get better service if you are from another country. We enjoyed our stay at Playa del Carmen, but I don't think I'll ever visit again nor recommend the Mosquito Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: mrshalldallas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Playa for our honeymoon and chose Mosquito Beach for the great location (right on the beach) and the very modern style of the hotel. Overall we had a good experience. The rooms are extremely small, with not much space for your stuff, but that isn't a big deal. They are very nicely appointed rooms, with awesome showers and very efficient A/C. The bed was very hard, which bothered my husband, but not me. The rooms are very dark, as other people have mentioned, but we enjoyed the cool and dark respite from the bright heat outside. The location was great. It's right on the main street in town, but you can also walk right out front to the beach. The restaurant is open-air and right on the beach, and has good food and service. There is a very nice pool and also a great set up at the beach with huge beds and umbrellas. We never had any trouble getting a spot. Having food and drinks delivered pool or beach-side was also nice. Also, the housekeeping was excellent and the rooms were very clean. The downside: the very noisy construction next door. Monday thru Saturday very loud construction occurred directly next to the pool. It wasn't too bothersome in our room, and the loud music in the beach area drowned it out, but it rendered the pool area mostly unusable. Even our ipods couldn't help us block out the noise. One other note, the front desk consists of one person sitting by the pool at a desk with a laptop. I would describe the overall service level of the front desk as "minimalistic". But again, the bell hop, housekeepers and restaurant were very good. If you enjoy modern design and a great location you will like this hotel, as long as you don't need a lot of space and are prepared for a fairly intrusive level of noise from the construction. Apparently it will go on for the next 6 months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tm0818
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel right on the beach. The staff was great and very helpful. The cleaning staff were just phenomenal. Right in the middle of everything i Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation NOT a guarantee”
Reviews.Author: texastraveller22
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip, had confirmation, called again before departure for Playa, yet when we arrived, we had NO room! We were sent to their sister facility--off the beach and several blocks away. No apology--no compensation--just a pain! Then, once they actually allowed us to move to the rooms we confirmed, we met at least 4 other couples who had the same problem. One couple was never given a room at the beach, but had to stay at the sister facility for their entire trip. This was not the first time this happened to the couple traveling with us. Without this problem, it would have been a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, perfect location, great food, but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: BlueFunElement
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay at a modern hotel steps away from the beach and less than a block from the hot main street, look no further! My husband and I stayed in Mosquito Beach hotel during the Memorial weekend, and the location was great. The rooms are small, but are ultra modern, complete with flat screen TV, A/C, and an amazing shower. The décor is simple and elegant. Our room was closest to the beach, right next to the hotel’s restaurant, which has amazing food (particularly great breakfast), and they can serve you on the beach, while you catch your tan. Being in the heart of the city, the hotel is an easy access to both water attractions and nightlife, from stores to restaurants it is all a few steps away! To that extent, it was enjoyable and a right location for our vacation needs. Playa del Carmen is in constant growth, so there is a hotel being built next door, but aside from morning work, it is really not an issue. However, there are two pieces of advice we left with them: service is poor, and there is no internet access (one has to go to the sister Mosquito hotel to gain free access to a computer and internet). What do we mean by poor service? My husband wanted to use an iron to iron his shirt before dinner, but the hotel has only one board and one iron, which you have to borrow from the main office. The trouble was, it took them three hours to deliver it and then they wanted it back within ten minutes, actually coming at our door to take it while he was still ironing his shirt. Second example – we ran out of shampoo and asked for an additional bottle. After repeatedly asking the service staff and the lobby for a bottle, we ended up getting one two days later! So, although we recommend the hotel for its location, beautiful design, great view, and fantastic food, be prepared for some not-so-great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraceNGrace
Reviews.Content: Mosquito Beach Hotel was in a perfect beachfront location and walking distance to all the shops, restaurants and bars. The hotel has an appearance of being very chic, it was very cute and different, but not so clean. The pool was too filmy to get in and poolside cushions looked as if they are never washed. The rooms are very small and dark with very poor lighting. Our room had a strange odor of rotting wood. Like I said, it is very cute, it had cute square toilets and nice shower, but it always smelled funny. We had a nice ocean view but had a clear view of the construction site right next door and could hear them start drilling and doing construction early in the morning. Three out of the six days we were there, the water was shut off which was extremely inconvenient, we only received one letter forwarning us for one night, the other days were a surprise. Service at their beach bar/restaurant was terrible. The best thing about this hotel was that it is across the street from a fabulous french restaurant, La Palette. We dined there every night, great food, cocktails and service!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we didn't stay in !”
Reviews.Author: Rambling_Sid_Rumpo
Reviews.Content: However you cut it, it was a bad day for travel. Thunderstorms had rumbled across Texas, delaying our Austin/Dallas, Dallas/Playa flights by a few hours. Luckily (so we thought) we had booked Expedia’s recommended transportation from the airport to the Mosquito Beach Hotel. Pretty well all the flights into Playa were delayed, so the transportation wasn’t phased at all. We were loaded up into the van with a number of other couples. Little did we realize that we were going to stop at every other hotel on the Maya Riviera on the way to the Mosquito Beach Hotel (which turned out to be the penultimate stop). Imagine our surprise when the driver thumped the van up onto the sidewalk in Playa, dumped us out and told us that we had to drag our luggage two and a half blocks to get to the hotel. Exhausted by the day, it was the last thing we needed. Be warned – the hotel is in an pedestrian area that taxis and vans cannot enter after 6 at night. After cussing out the gods of travel, we finally got to the reception desk to check in. Disappointed again. The manager explained that because of the construction taking place next door (the remodeling of the previously excellent El Faro hotel) our room (Beach front suite) had been ‘damaged’. Take note – as of June 07, construction is taking place ALL DAY, EVERY DAY ten feet from this hotel. Anyway, the manager told us that we have been moved to an ‘upgraded’ room in the Mosquito Blue hotel (the sister hotel) for just one night and would we care to walk there now. Yes - Walk there now, keeping a few paces behind the man who took our luggage. Well, my idea of an upgrade (from a beach front suite) and his idea are clearly 2 different things. The Mosquito Blue is about 4 blocks back from the beach in a dark and humid part of town. The ‘upgraded’ room was small, dark and smelled of mould (something else to note, if you have allergies). Come the morning we returned to the Beach hotel, had breakfast, viewed the construction site and asked when we could check in. Again, it wasn’t going to happen. We were in the ‘Blue’ for what appeared to be the duration. We called Expedia, only to be told that the management of the Beach hotel had told Expedia that we had called ahead and cancelled our booking! It was clear that the hotel was overbooked. A lot of wrangling and about $75 of international calls to Expedia and we were on our way to Cancun to take advantage of a great ‘on the day’ rate we locked in at a luxury hotel there. Be warned. The hotel looks great, but the management has some integrity issues to overcome. I hope your experience will be better than ours.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: cenoteNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mosquito Beach for 5 nights at the end of May. I originally picked it for its stylish decor, and proximity to the beach. The style loses its appeal after about a day or two when you realize you don't have much room to put your clothes or toiletries, and the darkness can get a bit gloomy. Amenities in general were nice though. Proximity to the beach, and use of the beds/chairs was great. Staff was all very friendly and not pushy at all. There WAS construction going on during my stay which didn't really bug me too much, but I opted to move anyway. The balcony got smoky when construction was going on, and the noise got annoying (although it never woke me, it was kind of off-putting to be in paradise with heavy machinery working over your head). Spoke to the front desk and they quickly and gracefully accomodated a move to Mosquito Blue, down the block and much quieter, roomier, and more 'functional'. You also still have access to the Mosquito Beach chairs/beds. Overall-- i wouldn't stay here again but it wasn't a bad experience. If you want to stay on the beach, Playa Maya 2 buildings over on the beach looks like a good bet. Otherwise, Mosquito Blue is a good choice if you want to stay in town. The facilities there are a bit more 'worn' (whereas everything was pretty new and well kept at Mosquito Beach) but things worked fine. There are 2 free internet PCs at Mosquito Blue, while MB only provides wireless (i didn't bring a laptop).

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Mosquito Beach!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelDenver
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days at Mosquito and had a wonderful vacation! I have been to Playa many times and have stayed everywhere and I thought this was the best small botique hotel! I loved the modern decor and the hotel itself if absolutely fabolous. The rooms were not that small. The bathrooms were nice there was tons of light. The room wasnt as dark as everyone has said. I dont spend much time in my room so I dont care as much. Really nice patios and they all had a ocean view. The bar/restaurant was really awesome. They are open from 9-midnight. The staff was very attentitive on the beach, the drinks were not overly expensive, the same as anywhere else. The hotel is on the best part of Playa's beach. No rocks, seaweed, nothing it was perfect. Little bit of coral but you had to swim pretty far out to see it or walk on it. They keep the beach as private as possible, only letting the guests in. There are many beach beds and loungers that were very comfortable. You can have the staff set you up a giant umbrella. I enjoy spending my mornings and evenings on 5th ave, so I can make some recomendations. The best coffee shop is Cafe Sasta and its really close. Awesome fresh coffe and good small breakfast, snacks, and cakes. We also stop by before we go home. Hemmingways, Brunos, the glass bar, and fiesta y siesta. Places to have drinks are OM, coco maya, blue parrot, deseo, basico, and mezcal. You have to go there for a shot, its mexican tradition. I would stay here again, you will have a great time at Mosquito Beach!!!! If you have any questions feel free to ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Construction work next door!!!”
Reviews.Author: amet
Reviews.Content: Please be very careful booking a hotel room here for the next few months, there is a very large constrution/building site next door which prohibited us from staying in our room, using the beach or having breakfast at the hotel. we were woken up at 8:30 every morning to loud pounding foundations drilling - the work continued until 6pm prohibiting us from having any sort of siesta. the hotel would only offer us 1 night at half rate as compensation despite the fact that they did not inform us of the building site next door before arrival. the lady at reception also informed me that they had no intention warning other guests who were to be arriving shortly of these problems. if you lie on the hotels private beach you cannot hear anything other than the building site.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel On Playa Beach”
Reviews.Author: missmacw
Reviews.Content: This is the best beach hotel on playa del carmen. Location is perfect, and the hotel has the best and nicest spot on the entire beach. The hotel was a bit small and yes there is a square toilet which was no big deal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I cannpt wait to go back. For some the cost of the room might be a little more than want to spend but between the room and beach front property it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out, cool and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mridders
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Playa del Carmen on the 15th April after spending 4 nights at the hotel, feel extremely relaxed and pampered. Felt I had to write this as some reviews before our stay had me feeling a bit cautious about staying here! So after a private transfer organised directly with the hotel, we arrived to our destination. This cost $120 return. The design of the hotel is so cool, stylish and well thought out. We booked one of the cheaper rooms and end up with a room on the pool, which was fab. The room (112) itself was very stylish and modern. It was a bit on the dark side but didn't bother me AT ALL - there was enough light to put on some make up if you wanted. There was no smell and the bed was so comfortable. We ate breakfast and lunch mostly at the hotel on the beach, and dinners elsewhere. Based on past reviews we woke up early to get a bed on the beach but noticed that they didn't fill up till around lunchtime anyway. Staff here are really helpful and friendly. Tip the guys who set up the chairs and umbrellas for you.... Other places to eat: try the mosquito blue restaurant called the Glass Door but not weekend. We ate here twice. The first time was amazing but the second time (on a Saturday and was packed) was really disappointing. We had breakfast at the coffee shop and also the "healthy food" restaurant - both really good options for a change. esp the healthy one. Anyway overall - stay here if looking for total adult relaxation! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: CateyCate
Reviews.Content: Before booking our first trip to Playa, I read all about this hotel. My boyfriend and I really loved the edgy look of the place. I don't like large herds of people & eating out of troft like buffets. I'd like to think my taste is a bit more refined than that. We didn't want an all-inclusive at all... We stayed from Easter Sunday April 8, 2007- April 12th. Our room was immediately ready upon arrival and when it was time to leave they offered a secure place for our luggage and suggested lounging around the beach or bar area until we had to leave. here's a very blunt breakdown of this hotel from our experience: *CENTRALLY LOCATED NEAR SHOPS & RESTAURANT'S *CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN!! *FRIENDLY STAFF *COMFY SHEETS & PILLOWS *FIRM BED *GREAT PLASMA TV'S *AWESOME POOL WITH TRENDY LOUNGING AREAS * NICE BEACHFRONT *PLENTY OF SEATING ON THE BEACH INCLUDING LOUNGING BEDS *FANTASTIC BATH SOAP/SHOWER GEL & SHAMPOO *FRESH TOWELS IN YOUR ROOM EVERYTIME YOU TURN AROUND! *ROOMS ARE ARTSY/MODERN/TRENDY *THE ROOM SMELLS GREAT-LIKE TEAK WOOD (smells exactly like the candle from ERGO "Monkey Grass") *RESTAURANT & BAR ON SITE *EFFICIENT HAIRDRYER -IT'S THE TYPICAL HOTEL ONE *IT'S A SHORT WALK TO THE BUS STATION-SO YOU CAN DO THE $8 A PERSON RIDE TO & FROM THE AIRPORT W/NO PROBLEM AT ALL! *Yes the rooms are dark if you have both sets of curtains pulled. *The room could smell musty if you turn your air off-but, consider this- it IS a humid area of the earth and it Does have lots of expensive wood that could put off that odor if you cut the air off. If you don't like to be cold put the air on like 25, but don't cut it off. *Yes if you are the type of girl that wears makeup on a beach vacation, you will need to bring a mirror to put makeup on out on the patio (it's not a big deal at all). *They are doing construction next door but it was not a big deal at all. No problems with odor. No problems with water pressure (it was great). No problems with service or staff.... No problems with the room key... No problems...but we did have to listen to a lady moan one night (I think they were in the room next to us but it sounded like the whole city and maybe some people in China could've heard it ?! just so you know...but I think they must have had their patio door open??!) Hotels that share the same sort of ambience: Ian Schrager Hotels (like Mondrian Hollywood & Hudson NY) Hotel ZaZa in Dallas (young/trendy/swanky) FOOD: 1) La Parilla is on the corner & it's delicious. 2) If you want cheap & yummy tacos try Dr Taco on 10th (just walk straight up from the hotel to 10th and take a right-you'll see it) They have dollar tacos. little but yummy! 3) AJUA is an absolute must!!!! I only wish we would've known about it sooner than our last night!!! 4) 100% Natrual Restaurant is great too, great breakfast. Fresh juices all healthy stuff that's tasty!! 5) Cheap Tacos-try the 24hour taco stand that looks like a VW Bus...I know-sounds weird but it was so very delicious I ate there several times & it's like 90 pesos a taco, get like 3 chicken tacos & a coke...you'll be pleased. We took several photos to help others readers make their decision. We were more than pleased with everything. We would absolutely recommend this to our friends! We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

HotelInfo.Name: Mosquito Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 8 y Zona Federal Maritima, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
